solution.text:
Let the present age of Ram be x years
And, the present age of Shyam be y years
Then, according to the question:
x = y +_{i}_------(1)
And x - _{j}_ = _{k}_(y - _{j}_) --------(2)
Simplifying the obtained pair of equations:
x - y = _{i}_ -------(3)
x - _{k}_y = _{{-k*j+j}}_ ------(4)
Now, Finding 2 solutions of each equation to draw the graphs of the equations
x - y = _{i}_ -------(3)
x 0 _{i}_
y -_{i}_ 0
x - _{k}_y = _{{-k*j+j}}_ ------(4)
x 0 _{{j*(1-k)}}_
y _{{trunc((Decimal(k)-1)*j/k,2)}}_ 0
Plot graph for obtained data:
Where M = (0,-_{i}_), N = (_{i}_,0), O = (0,_{{trunc((Decimal(k)-1)*j/k,2)}}_) and P = (_{{j*(1-k)}}_,0)
We observe that there is a point Q common to both the lines AB and CD.
So the solution of the pair of linear equation is x = _{{trunc((Decimal(k)*i+k*j-j)/(k-1),2)}}_years , and y = _{{trunc((Decimal(i)+k*j-j)/(k-1),2)}}_years

content.text: Ram is _{i}_ years older than Shyam and _{j}_ years ago his age was _{k}_times of Shyam's age.Find their present ages graphically.
